chunks.en: My phone has been used for six years, has anyone used theirs longer?

Samsung S9+. Since the advent of notched screens, punch-hole screens, and various other strange-shaped screens, I've given up on the idea of replacing my phone, even though replacing the battery on the S9+ couldn't fix the terrible battery life.
Recently, it's finally become unbearable with the lag; a strange-shaped screen is fine.
After looking around, I don't know what to buy. The basic requirements are only battery life, photography, and no built-in advertisements.
First, eliminate Huawei and Apple.
Then, the new Samsung is too expensive.
The remaining domestic phones don't have ads.
Damn.
Bought a Xiaomi 6 on January 4, 2018, planning to change it this year.
OnePlus 8T, haven't found the pain point of needing to replace the phone yet.
Buy a second-hand Samsung flagship from two or three years ago. End of Post.
Almost 5 years. It should still work without any issues. realme x
My R15X with Snapdragon 660 has been used for 5 years.
My phone has been used for three and a half months ğŸ˜‚
@nzynzynzy Buying second-hand CPUs, hard drives, and other components is fine, but I can't accept a second-hand phone.
I always buy a new phone for my wife, and then my wife gives me her old phone; currently using an iPhone X.
Actually, I still recommend iPhone.
If Apple doesn't work, I suggest buying a phone with a large-capacity battery that can flash overseas systems.
The price of the S23 Ultra can't hold up anymore, I estimate it will soon start with a 5, you can consider it.
Samsung Note2, replaced the battery 3 times (the advantage of removable batteries), rooted and now it's used for remote clocking in. End of Post.
S20U is going to the after-sales service to replace the battery.
mate 20x 5 and a half years
Used Honor V10 from 2018 until last year...
My iPhone 6SP has been used for over 6 years
XR is going to hold on for another year
Bought an XR at the end of 2018, and replaced the screen manually last month, ready for another battle
My XR from 2018, my colleague is still using 8P

chunks.en: @crayygy The original plan was to wait for the S24U to come out and replace the 23U, but the reviews of the 24U don't seem good, and the price of the 23U has risen instead of falling. Now I don't know when it's suitable to wait. I want the price to drop more before buying, but I'm afraid the 23U will be out of stock if I wait too long.
Actually, I don't like that pen, I want the 23+, but the 23+ battery is too small.
@zhang1215 You're a bit amazing.

chunks.en: A few months ago, I replaced my iPhone 6s with my wife's iPhone 12.
